metadata.synopsis: After making a horrific discovery in the basement of an old abandoned church, Trish (Gina Philips) and her brother Darry (Justin Long) watch their routine road trip home from college turn into a heart-stopping race for their lives. They find themselves the chosen prey of an indestructible force that relentlessly pursues them and gives a new and chilling meaning to the old song "Jeepers Creepers."

reviews: It's chock-full of memorable moments, snappy dialogue and clever touches.
A welcome addition to the horror genre and sure to become a cult classic...
Jeepers Creepers still holds a lot of the power it did over a decade ago thanks in large part to its ability to morph and change styles during its brisk 90-minute running time.
There's little doubt that Salva delivers an almost astonishingly effective opening stretch...
The film isn't helped by a actress whose resemblance to Ashlee Simpson may predispose you to want her disposed of.

An absurd horror yarn in which a cannibalistic winged demon goes on a murderous rampage whenever he hears the title tune. Personally, "Sussudio" and "Rude" are the only songs that would conceivably make me take a hatchet to someone's head, but I digress.
A good way to find some genuinely creepy moments in a decade where they were short in supply.
One of the most terrifying horror movies to come along in years...
One genuinely gets the sense from the first hour of this film that Salva is exorcising some of his own demons.
One of those horror movies in which its characters do such unbelievably stupid things all the time that you literally want to shout at them.
The only thing about this movie that really made me shudder is that we are probably going to be deluged with a bunch of crappy sequels for it.
As the plot hemorrhages from one dire encounter to another, the clichd old psychic routine is used to explain the plot to anyone who might still care.
...Alternates between moments of sheer terror and ridiculously cheesy effects...
The story hits a wall with an abrupt, dismal ending.
